alternative_parents.description: Esters of sulfonic acid, which have the general structure RS(=O)2OR' (R,R' = organyl group or H).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfonic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Esters of sulfonic acid, which have the general structure RS(=O)2OR' (R,R' = organyl, not H).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Organonitrogen compounds containing a quaternary ammonium substituted with four alkyl chains.
alternative_parents.name: Tetraalkylammonium salts

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonyl group, with the general structure RS(=O)2R' ( R,R' must not be H).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfonyls

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
alternative_parents.name: Organic salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a positive electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic cations

class.description: Organic compounds containing a linear aliphatic chain (or ring system) carrying a C-X bond, where X is a halogen atom.
class.name: Alkyl halides

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as perfluoroalkyl sulfonic acid and derivatives. These are organic compounds containing an alkyl chain attached to the sulfur of a sulfonic acid group (or a derivative thereof), where all hydrogens of the alkyl chain are replaced by fluorine atoms.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain attached to the sulfur of a sulfonic acid group (or a derivative thereof), where all hydrogens of the alkyl chain are replaced by fluorine atoms.
direct_parent.name: Perfluoroalkyl sulfonic acid and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
subclass.name: Alkyl fluorides

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and a halogen atom (At, F, Cl, Br, I).
superclass.name: Organohalogen compounds
